title: Malaysia central bank says Google misquoted exchange rate a second time
description:
(Image: Reuters)

KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia's central bank said on Saturday that Google had misquoted the ringgit 's exchange rate , undervaluing the currency against the dollar, and that it would seek an explanation from the tech giant.The ringgit, which declined to a 26-year low last month, has weake...

title: Malaysia central bank holds key rate
description:
Malaysia central bank holds key rate

A motorcyclist rides in front of the Malaysia's central mank building in Kuala Lumpur on Feb 25, 2015. Bang Negara Malaysia on Thursday kept its key interest rate unchanged. (EPA photo)

title: Malaysia ringgit rally: Importers cheer, tourism braces for slowdown, Singaporeans unfazed
description:
JOHOR BAHRU/SINGAPORE: The Malaysian ringgit’s rally to its highest level against the United States dollar in over a year has been a boon for Malaysian garment maker Chua Hunt.

Chua’s company, D&R Garments Manufacturing, has a factory in Xiamen, China, and the stronger ringgit has made it cheaper t...

title: BMI: Malaysia’s 2025 growth forecast revised up to 4.6pc, maintained at 4.1pc for next year
description:
KUALA LUMPUR, Nov 18 — Malaysia’s economic growth is set to be stronger than previously expected this year, driven largely by domestic consumption, according to the latest outlook from BMI Research, a unit of Fitch Solutions.

Data released on November 14 showed Malaysia’s economy expanded 5.2 per c...

title: Malaysia leads Southeast Asia’s digital economic growth
description:
Malaysia is now the fastest-growing digital economy in Southeast Asia with a year-on-year increase of 19%, and on track to reach $39 billion in gross merchandise value (GMV) this year, according to the 10th edition of the e-Conomy SEA Report 2025.

The report, released by Google, Temasek, and Bain &...

title: Brics ties boost Malaysia’s trade, exports as govt eyes faster growth, says Wisma Putra
description:
KUALA LUMPUR, Dec 2 — The government views Malaysia’s involvement in Brics as being aligned with efforts to drive the national economy to grow more rapidly, sustainably and resiliently.

The Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Wisma Putra), in a written reply on the Parliament website, said that Brics offe...

title: Malaysia’s economy grows 2.9% in Q2, weakest in nearly two years
description:
Malaysia’s economic growth dropped to 2.9% in the second quarter, hitting the lowest in nearly two years due to weaker exports and a global slowdown, the central bank said on Friday.

Bank Negara Malaysia also said the country’s full-year economic expansion will come in at the lower end of the 4% to...

title: Fiscal measures will ease country's debt pressure by late 2028, Dewan Rakyat told
description:
KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia’s debt pressure is expected to ease by late 2028 and into 2029, in line with the government’s fiscal consolidation path, says Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim.

He said the government had already reduced annual new borrowing from RM100bil previously to about RM70bil at ...

title: Malaysia forecasts 4.3-4.7% economic growth in 2026
description:
Kuala Lumpur (VNA) – Malaysia’s economy is expected to maintain steady growth in 2026 despite persistent global uncertainties, according to economic experts.

Affin Bank chief economist Alan Tan Chew Leong said that although global risks are rising, including pressure from the US economy, geopolitic...

title: Malaysia poised to become ASEAN’s second-fastest growing economy in 2025: Reports
description:
KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia is poised to emerge as the second-fastest growing economy in Southeast Asia, after several financial institutions raised their growth forecasts.

HSBC Global Investment Research is the latest to turn more optimistic, upgrading its 2025 growth forecast for Malaysia from 4.2 per...

title: Malaysia’s BRICS Partner Country status to boost economic growth, says Foreign Ministry
description:
KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia’s involvement as a BRICS Partner Country supports efforts to drive faster, more stable and resilient economic growth, says the Foreign Ministry.

Datuk Seri Mohamad Hasan said Malaysia officially became a BRICS Partner Country on Jan 1.

title: Anwar: Malaysia’s fiscal deficit could shrink ‘significantly’ by 2028-29 if reforms continue
description:
KUALA LUMPUR, Dec 2 — The government could reverse decades of fiscal deficit by 2028 or 2029 if it commits to reforms that limit new borrowings and prudent spending, Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim told Parliament today.

The Tambun MP said his administration is on course to narrow the defic...

title: DBS reaffirms Malaysia's outlook but flags US chip tariffs as downside risk
description:
DBS reaffirms Malaysia's outlook, forecasting GDP growth of 4% in 2026 and 4.2% in 2027 but flags US chip tariffs as downside risk

title: Malaysia's unemployment rate falls to 3.4% in 2023
description:
Malaysia's unemployment rate in 2023 continued its downward trend, lessened by 0.5 percentage points to 3.4 per cent from 3.9 per cent in the previous year, official data showed Tuesday.

The Department of Statistics Malaysia (DOSM) said in a statement that the unemployment rate last year was almost...
